intro: Oliganthes rufescens, commonly known as the red-hued desert cactus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of bright red flowers. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent structure, which stores water efficiently. Its flowers are typically short-lived but attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Oliganthes rufescens plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for desert wildlife.
